headline.print_headline: Iran Is Invited to Join U.S., Russia and Europe for Talks on Political Answer in Syria
headline.main: Iran Is Invited to Join U.S., Russia and Europe for Talks on Syria’s Future

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.

snippet: If Iran agrees to attend the meeting in Vienna this week, it will be the first time Secretary of State John Kerry will enter formal negotiations with Tehran since the nuclear accord reached in July.
abstract: Iran is invited to join discussions with Russia, United States and European countries on whether political solution is possible in Syria's civil war; invitation is recognition that Iran's voice is important concerning succession issues surrounding Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad.
lead_paragraph: If Iran agrees to attend the meeting in Vienna this week, it will be the first time Secretary of State John Kerry will enter formal negotiations with Tehran since the nuclear accord reached in July.
